title: Drawing, "Arabesque Panel", ca. 1770
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, white gouache on white laid paper
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description:
The design springs from two seated female figures with a vase between them, from which rises a column supporting prancing horses. Above, a relief panel and a semi-circular columned niche with a statue of a stand-female figure before a drapery. Atalantes at either side and seated griffins above. At top, a medallion supported by flying half-figures, above which are winged female figures bearing trumpets and wreaths, flanking a lyre. Arabesque tendrils connect the various parts. (RPW'60)
Attribution to Prieur made by Leon Decloux.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource
Elias Pelletrau: Long Island Silversmith and His Sources of Design
